alert.note: Alert for Inland Volusia; Northern Lake County; Southern Lake County (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 02 at 1:50PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Lake and northwestern Volusia Counties through 230 PM EDT... At 148 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles northeast of Paisley, moving northeast at 30 mph. Another strong storm about 12 miles west of Leesburg will move northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Deltona, DeLand, Leesburg and Eustis. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or hard-topped vehicle. Remember, when thunder roars, go indoors! A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 700 PM EDT for east central Florida.

area.areaDesc: Inland Volusia; Northern Lake County; Southern Lake County
